metadata.title: CVE-2017-16538 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
drivers/media/usb/dvb-usb-v2/lmedm04.c in the Linux kernel through 4.13.11allows local users to cause a denial of service (general protection faultand system crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a craftedUSB device, related to a missing warm-start check and incorrect attachtiming (dm04_lme2510_frontend_attach versus dm04_lme2510_tuner).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16538` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-121-generic - 4.4.0-121.145
linux-image-4.4.0-121-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-121.145
linux-image-4.4.0-121-lowlatency - 4.4.0-121.145
linux-image-4.4.0-121-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-121.145
linux-image-4.4.0-121-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-121.145
linux-image-4.4.0-121-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-121.145
linux-image-4.4.0-121-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-121.145
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-121-generic - 4.4.0-121.145
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1087-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1087.95
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1090-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1090.95
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1055-aws - 4.4.0-1055.64
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1013-azure - 4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1014-gcp - 4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1021-kvm - 4.4.0-1021.26
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-121.145').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1087.95').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1090.95').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1055.64').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1021.26').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1008.10').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
